p: A. melegueta, also known as ‘alligator pepper’ or ‘grain of paradise’, is a perennial plant native to western Africa, and its seeds are used as a spice in food due to their aromatic flavor and pungent taste or as ingredients of ethnomedical preparations for the treatment of snakebites, stomachaches, and diarrhea [ 22]. Antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, anticancer, and antioxidant properties have been reported for alligator pepper [ 23]. Concerning seed volatile constituents, they showed repellent activity against adults of the maize weevil Sitophilus zeamais [ 24].
